definition: to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means

sentences.english: It is going to be electrical insulators.
sentences.chinese: 它必须是电子的绝缘体。

sentences.english: He taught the students to make the insulator.
Porcelain prevents electricity from passing through it, which is often used as insulator.
sentences.chinese: 瓷料使电流不能在其中通过，因此它常被用作绝缘体。

sentences.english: A form of coaxial cable which uses air as a dielectric.
sentences.chinese: 一种同轴电缆形式，使用空气作为绝缘体。

sentences.english: And in other cases, they behave more nearly as insulators.
sentences.chinese: 在别的情况下，它们更像绝缘体。

sentences.english: Thinner dielectrics, however, are more susceptible to ESD overstress.
sentences.chinese: 然而，较薄的绝缘体更容易受ESD的影响。

sentences.english: A conductor is a poor insulator because it has a low resistance to such flow.
sentences.chinese: 导体可说是不良绝缘体，因为它的电阻很低。

sentences.english: What would happen if there were no insulators?
sentences.chinese: 假如没有绝缘体，会发生什么事？

sentences.english: For physicists, the interest in topological insulators does not end with their spintronic promise.
sentences.chinese: 但物理学家对拓扑绝缘体的兴趣并没有止于电子自旋。

sentences.english: The insulation may be any material which can withstand temperatures up to 200 degrees C.
sentences.chinese: 绝缘体可以是任何材料能耐200摄氏度高温。

sentences.english: Therefore, insulator handling should be minimized;
sentences.chinese: 所以，应当尽量减少拿取绝缘体。

sentences.english: Many ceramics are good electrical and thermal insulators.
sentences.chinese: 许多陶瓷都是电和热的良绝缘体。

definition: to have no contact with/to be cut off from/(electricity) to insulate
